content.description: Start low on the arete. Fight the barn door up good holds to the jug that sits about 8 inches back from the center of the lip. Mantle out. A fall could be bad, as you would fall off the platform that Nucleus sits on. Make sure you're solid on the grade before attempting.
Left block is off. Staying true to the arete, start matched on chest high edges with smeared feet. Work up the arete to top out.
content.location: Look for the obvious crack that separates the two large boulders. Climb the arete that sits on the left end of the block on the right.

content.description: SDS with matched hands on the horizontal slot at the left side of the roof. Get a right hand to a small intermediary crimp then make a huge full span bump to the massive jug. Match the jug, smear left foot, and right heel the rail system to get geared up for the throw. Make a massive dyno off of the heel to the lip above. Mantle out.
content.location: Left side of the roof on the right side of Nucleus.

content.description: Same start as Nuclear Arete, but use both blocks to make your way up the crack. Catch a layback halfway up for an easy ride to the top.
content.location: Climb the obvious massive crack that separates the two boulders.

content.description: SDS start on the horizontal slot at the left side of the roof (same start as dyno problem). Move left around the face into the diagonal crimp crack that runs the length of the face. Climb the crack to link up to Nuclear Arete and top out per. Brutal..
content.location: Small horizontal crimp crack that runs the full face of the right block of Nucleus.

content.description: Split block sitting on top of a flat rock.
